title: Explosive Trump Biopic To Hit US Theaters Before Election: Reports
content: A controversial biopic of Donald Trump that depicts the former president raping his wife and which has drawn legal threats from his attorneys will hit US theaters this October, it was reported Friday.
summary: A controversial biopic of Donald Trump that depicts the former president raping his wife and which has drawn legal threats from his attorneys will hit US theaters this October, it was reported Friday.

title: Russia Says It Made No Deals With Arrested Telegram CEO Pavel Durov
content: The Kremlin has never made any deals with Telegram boss Pavel Durov, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday, adding that he was not aware of any meetings between the tech entrepreneur and Russian President Vladimir Putin.
summary: The Kremlin has never made any deals with Telegram boss Pavel Durov, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday, adding that he was not aware of any meetings between the tech entrepreneur and Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Behind Telegram CEO's Arrest, A Paris Cybercrime Unit With Big Ambitions
content: The investigation into Telegram boss Pavel Durov that has fired a warning shot to global tech titans was started by a small cybercrime unit within the Paris prosecutor's office, led by 38-year-old Johanna Brousse.
summary: The investigation into Telegram boss Pavel Durov that has fired a warning shot to global tech titans was started by a small cybercrime unit within the Paris prosecutor's office, led by 38-year-old Johanna Brousse.

title: French Man Accused Of Drugging Wife, Recruiting Over 50 People To Rape Her
content: A French retiree goes on trial Monday accused of recruiting dozens of strangers online to rape his wife after he drugged her into unconsciouness, in a case that has horrified the country.
summary: A French retiree goes on trial Monday accused of recruiting dozens of strangers online to rape his wife after he drugged her into unconsciouness, in a case that has horrified the country.

title: Singaporean Man Plants 'Death Penalty' Weed In Wife's Car, Jailed
content: A Singaporean man has been sentenced to nearly four years behind bars after attempting to frame his estranged wife by placing cannabis in her car, knowing she could get the death penalty.
summary: A Singaporean man has been sentenced to nearly four years behind bars after attempting to frame his estranged wife by placing cannabis in her car, knowing she could get the death penalty.

title: Ukraine Air Force Commander Dismissed Day After F-16 Jet Crash
content: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy dismissed Ukraine's Air Force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk on Friday, according to a presidential decree.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy dismissed Ukraine's Air Force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk on Friday, according to a presidential decree.

title: Namibia To Kill 700 Animals, Including Hippos For Meat Amid Severe Drought
content: The meat will be distributed to those affected as part of a drought relief program. This comes amid an ongoing El Nino-induced drought that has impacted 68 million people in Southern Africa, leading to widespread food shortages.
summary: The meat will be distributed to those affected as part of a drought relief program. This comes amid an ongoing El Nino-induced drought that has impacted 68 million people in Southern Africa, leading to widespread food shortages.

title: Kalpana Chawla's Death Weighed On NASA In Sunita Williams Decision
content: The death of Indian-origin American astronaut Kalpana Chawla and six others on February 1, 2003 when the space shuttle Columbia broke up and burnt as it re-entered the Earth's atmosphere played heavily in the minds of NASA officials.
summary: The death of Indian-origin American astronaut Kalpana Chawla and six others on February 1, 2003 when the space shuttle Columbia broke up and burnt as it re-entered the Earth's atmosphere played heavily in the minds of NASA officials.

title: PM Modi To Visit Singapore On September 4-5 To Bolster Strategic Ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Singapore in the first week of September, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) announced on Friday.The visit will be crucial in further strengthening bilateral ties between the two nations.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Singapore in the first week of September, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) announced on Friday.The visit will be crucial in further strengthening bilateral ties between the two nations.

title: France Takes Action Against Screen Addiction With Smartphone Ban In Schools
content: In response to growing concerns about excessive screen time, France has introduced a law banning smartphones and other electronic devices in schools for students up to age 15.
summary: In response to growing concerns about excessive screen time, France has introduced a law banning smartphones and other electronic devices in schools for students up to age 15.

title: "Misleading Narrative": Foreign Ministry Blasts CNN Bangladesh Flood Report
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has once again trashed reports that the flooding in some areas of Bangladesh were caused by the opening of a dam on the Gumti River in Tripura.
summary: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has once again trashed reports that the flooding in some areas of Bangladesh were caused by the opening of a dam on the Gumti River in Tripura.

title: Your Drinking Habits Could Impact Your Grandchildren's Lives
content: Despite prior knowledge of the mental and social impacts of paternal drinking, the biological consequences on physical health were less understood.
summary: Despite prior knowledge of the mental and social impacts of paternal drinking, the biological consequences on physical health were less understood.

title: OpenAI, Anthropic Sign Deals With US Govt For AI Research And Testing
content: The first-of-their-kind agreements come at a time when the companies are facing regulatory scrutiny over safe and ethical use of AI technologies.
summary: The first-of-their-kind agreements come at a time when the companies are facing regulatory scrutiny over safe and ethical use of AI technologies.

title: A Hormone Makes Starfish Lose Limb To Survive Predators. Humans Have It Too
content: Researchers have identified the hormone that triggers a starfish to shed its limbs to survive predators, describing it as being similar to the one controlling appetite in humans.
summary: Researchers have identified the hormone that triggers a starfish to shed its limbs to survive predators, describing it as being similar to the one controlling appetite in humans.

title: Why More Americans Find One Job No Longer Enough To Survive
content: The gig economy, once seen as a side hustle, has become essential for supplementing income as inflation outpaces wage increases.
summary: The gig economy, once seen as a side hustle, has become essential for supplementing income as inflation outpaces wage increases.

title: In Shocking Discovery, NASA Finds Invisible Electric Field Around Earth
content: This electric field drives the polar wind, propelling charged particles into space at supersonic speeds and shaping Earth's atmosphere, particularly over the poles.
summary: This electric field drives the polar wind, propelling charged particles into space at supersonic speeds and shaping Earth's atmosphere, particularly over the poles.

title: Ajit Doval Meets Lankan President, Discusses Ongoing Economic Collaboration
content: National Security Adviser Ajit Doval today called on Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe and discussed the ongoing bilateral economic collaboration.
summary: National Security Adviser Ajit Doval today called on Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe and discussed the ongoing bilateral economic collaboration.

title: Opinion: Never Before Has Defence Been So Important For India-US Ties
content: The visit underscored a clear trend: while major defence deals continue to strengthen traditional security ties, both nations are increasingly emphasising emerging strategic elements to integrate the security partnership
summary: The visit underscored a clear trend: while major defence deals continue to strengthen traditional security ties, both nations are increasingly emphasising emerging strategic elements to integrate the security partnership

title: Taliban Rejects UN Criticism Of Morality Law As Insult To Islamic Values
content: The Taliban government's morality police said it would not cooperate with the United Nation's mission in Afghanistan, calling it "an opposing side".
summary: The Taliban government's morality police said it would not cooperate with the United Nation's mission in Afghanistan, calling it "an opposing side".

title: Boeing's Uncrewed Starliner Capsule Could Return After Sep 6, Says NASA
content: NASA will proceed with the undocking of the uncrewed Boeing Starliner capsule not before Sept. 6, the space agency said on Thursday after concluding a review.
summary: NASA will proceed with the undocking of the uncrewed Boeing Starliner capsule not before Sept. 6, the space agency said on Thursday after concluding a review.
